paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant N588K, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic with short QT interval detected during screening.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We report on an asymptomatic 10-year-old boy who had a short QT interval (corrected QT interval, 260 ms).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Carried the same mutation but no symptoms reported.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The same mutation was observed in his mother.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation causes a gain of function in the rapid component of the delayed rectifying potassium current, IKr.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was asymptomatic but had a family history of sudden cardiac death.
key_quotes: This mutation has been known to cause a gain of function in the rapid component of the delayed rectifying potassium current, IKr.
SQTS was screened for in the regular examination for school children, but he had been free from arrhythmic events.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
